{"step_by_step_thinking": "The documents suggest that the ideal medium for storing an avulsed tooth should maintain the viability of the periodontal ligament (PDL) cells. While Viaspan, Hanks balanced salt solution, and coconut water have been mentioned as potential storage media, milk is consistently highlighted as the most convenient, cheapest, and readily available solution. It is also capable of keeping PDL cells alive. Therefore, despite the potential of other solutions, milk seems to be the most practical choice.", "answer_choice": "D. Milk"}
